title: Will we beable to keep using legacy client after it goes live?
body:
Preface : I always enjoy how much effort Riot puts into their game.

With that being said, I don't really enjoy the new client layout... It looks smooth however there are just too many things that are inconvenient like adjusting my rune pages or even post game lobby. I would really prefer to keep the old simpler design and for the information I usually look at, it seems to be more efficient.  Not only that, ever since i downloaded the beta client its crashed 2/3rd of the time I try to load it.

replies.body:
You can continue to launch into the Legacy client from the login screen for now, but eventually, the new client will completely replace the Legacy Client, obviously when it's more polished and stable. Below is a screenshot showing where you can launch the Legacy Client.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/215576628/Launch-Legacy-Client.jpg

Let me know if you have any questions.

Being able to use the legacy client is helpful for the moment, but the new client eats up a truckload of resources. This causes problems such as causing severe delays in champ select, hard enough that you cannot change masteries, select champions, etc.

Is significantly reducing this issue on the radar for potential clean-ups before the beta goes live as the only client option? Or is that not included in 'polished and stable'?

I would imagine that would be included in the *stable* part of *polished and stable*. I cannot speak for the team that's working on the new client, though. 

We'll have to wait and see what happens. Let me know if you have any further questions.

My main question was answered however I hope you guys decide against taking away loading the legacy option. I prefer it 100% over the newer model, No offense because I know you guys worked hard on it.
